By assigning an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Farmer[COLOR_REVERT] to this profession, your stores will brim over with barley!

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres brasseurs[COLOR_REVERT] produce deux fois plus de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bière[COLOR_REVERT] à partir d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]orge[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Bierbrauer[COLOR_REVERT] verarbeiten doppelt soviele Gerste in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bier[COLOR_REVERT], wie andere Kolonisten.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: If you suddenly find yourself in need of large quantities of [LINK=YIELD_BEER]Beer[\LINK], as can happen sometimes, then the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewer[COLOR_REVERT] can help you out. In the [LINK=PROFESSION_BREWER]Brewer[\LINK] profession, he is capable of creating double the normal amount of Beer as regular colonists would from [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]Master Brewers can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], and they can also be [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Trained[\LINK] in a colony with a [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]College[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres brasseurs[COLOR_REVERT] produce deux fois plus de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bière[COLOR_REVERT] à partir d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]orge[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Bierbrauer[COLOR_REVERT] verarbeiten doppelt soviele Gerste in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bier[COLOR_REVERT], wie andere Kolonisten.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brewer's House[COLOR_REVERT] is the lowest level of brewery buildings. Colonists assigned to the profession of [LINK=PROFESSION_BREWER]Brewer[\LINK] brew [LINK=YIELD_BEER]Beer[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK] in this building. Use [LINK=UNIT_BREWER]Master Brewers[\LINK] to drastically increase the output, or upgrade this building to a [LINK=BUILDING_BREWERY]Brewery[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [TAB]La [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maison du brasseur[COLOR_REVERT] est le bâtiment de base pour distiller de la bière. Les colons avec pour profession brasseur produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bière[COLOR_REVERT] à partir d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]orge[COLOR_REVERT]. Assignez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres brasseurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre production.
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brauhaus[COLOR_REVERT] ist die kleinste Stufe einer Braugebäudes. Bierbrauer produzieren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bier[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gerste[COLOR_REVERT]. Dieser Prozess ist noch effektiver, wenn Sie dem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Bierbrauer[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen.
TEXT.Italian: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brewers House[COLOR_REVERT] is the lowest level of brewery buildings. Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.
TEXT.Spanish: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brewers House[COLOR_REVERT] is the lowest level of brewery buildings. Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brewery[COLOR_REVERT] is the intermediate level of brewery buildings. Colonists assigned to the profession of [LINK=PROFESSION_BREWER]Brewer[\LINK] brew [LINK=YIELD_BEER]Beer[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK] in this building faster than they would in a [LINK=BUILDING_BREWERS_HOUSE]Brewer's House[\LINK]. Use [LINK=UNIT_BREWER]Master Brewers[\LINK] to drastically increase the output, or upgrade this building to a [LINK=BUILDING_BEER_FACTORY]Beer Factory[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [TAB]La [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brasserie[COLOR_REVERT] est le bâtiment intermédiaire pour distiller de la bière. Les colons avec pour profession brasseur produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bière[COLOR_REVERT] à partir d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]orge[COLOR_REVERT]. Assignez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres brasseurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre production.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brauerei[COLOR_REVERT] ist die mittlere Stufe einer Braugebäudes. Bierbrauer produzieren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bier[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gerste[COLOR_REVERT]. Dieser Prozess ist noch effektiver, wenn Sie dem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Bierbrauer[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen.
TEXT.Italian: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brewery[COLOR_REVERT] is the intermediate level of brewery buildings. Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.
TEXT.Spanish: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brewery[COLOR_REVERT] is the intermediate level of brewery buildings. Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer Factory[COLOR_REVERT] is the highest level of brewery buildings. Colonists assigned to the profession of [LINK=PROFESSION_BREWER]Brewer[\LINK] brew [LINK=YIELD_BEER]Beer[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK] in this building faster than they would in a [LINK=BUILDING_BREWERY]Brewery[\LINK]. Use [LINK=UNIT_BREWER]Master Brewers[\LINK] to drastically increase the output.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brasserie industrielle[COLOR_REVERT] est le bâtiment le plus avancé pour distiller de la bière. Les colons avec pour profession brasseur produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bière[COLOR_REVERT] à partir d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]orge[COLOR_REVERT]. Assignez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres brasseurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre production.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bierfabrik[COLOR_REVERT] ist die höchste Stufe einer Braugebäudes. Bierbrauer produzieren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bier[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gerste[COLOR_REVERT]. Dieser Prozess ist noch effektiver, wenn Sie dem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Bierbrauer[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen.
TEXT.Italian: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer Factory[COLOR_REVERT] is the highest level of brewery buildings. Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.
TEXT.Spanish: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer Factory[COLOR_REVERT] is the highest level of brewery buildings. Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Brewers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] are valuable cogs in your Food-production machinery. These specialists are capable of slaughtering double the number of [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK] in the same amount of time as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Free Colonist[COLOR_REVERT] would, when assigned to either the [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_SHEEP]Butcher (Sheep)[\LINK] or [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_CATTLE]Butcher (Cattle)[\LINK] profession. So they produce twice as much [LINK=YIELD_WOOL]Wool[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HIDES]Cowhides[\LINK] and in addition to this, Master Butchers produce an equal amount of [LINK=YIELD_FOOD] as well![PARAGRAPH:1]Master Butchers can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], and they can also be [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Trained[\LINK] in a colony with a [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]College[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres bouchers[COLOR_REVERT] produisent deux fois plus de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nourriture[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]laine[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]peaux[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mouton[COLOR_REVERT] et de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bétail[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Schlachtermeister[COLOR_REVERT] produzieren doppelt so viel [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nahrung[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolle[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tierhäute[COLOR_REVERT] von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schafen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rindern[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butcher's House[COLOR_REVERT] is the lowest level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_SHEEP]Butcher (Sheep)[\LINK] or [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_CATTLE]Butcher (Cattle)[\LINK] produce [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK], and [LINK=YIELD_WOOL]Wool[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HIDES]Cowhides[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK]. Use [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master Butchers[\LINK] to drastically increase the output, or upgrade this building to a [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERY]Butchery[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information about obtaining Food, see [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Food[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [TAB]La [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maison du boucher[COLOR_REVERT] est le bâtiment de base pour procéder la viande. Les colons avec pour profession boucher produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nourriture[COLOR_REVERT], de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]laine[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]peaux[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mouton[COLOR_REVERT] et de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bétail[COLOR_REVERT]. Assignez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres bouchers[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre production.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Metzgerhaus[COLOR_REVERT] ist die niedrigste Ausbaustufe des Gebäudes zum Schlachten von Vieh. Siedler im Beruf des Metzgers produzieren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nahrung[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolle[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rinderhäute[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schafen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rindern[COLOR_REVERT]. Durch [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Metzger[COLOR_REVERT] wird die Produktion drastisch erhöht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butchers House[COLOR_REVERT] is the lowest level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession Butcher produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butchers House[COLOR_REVERT] is the lowest level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession Butcher produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butchery[COLOR_REVERT] is the intermediate level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_SHEEP]Butcher (Sheep)[\LINK] or [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_CATTLE]Butcher (Cattle)[\LINK] produce [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK], and [LINK=YIELD_WOOL]Wool[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HIDES]Cowhides[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK]. They do this twice as fast as they would in a [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]Butcher's House[\LINK]. Use [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master Butchers[\LINK] to drastically increase the output, or upgrade this building to a [LINK=BUILDING_SLAUGHTERHOUSE]Slaughterhouse[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information about obtaining Food, see [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Food[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [TAB]La [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boucherie[COLOR_REVERT] est le bâtiment intermédiaire pour procéder la viande. Les colons avec pour profession boucher produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nourriture[COLOR_REVERT], de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]laine[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]peaux[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mouton[COLOR_REVERT] et de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bétail[COLOR_REVERT]. Assignez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres bouchers[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre production.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Metzgerei[COLOR_REVERT] ist die mittlere Ausbaustufe des Gebäudes zum Schlachten von Vieh. Siedler im Beruf des Metzgers produzieren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nahrung[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolle[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rinderhäute[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schafen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rindern[COLOR_REVERT]. Durch [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Metzger[COLOR_REVERT] wird die Produktion drastisch erhöht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butchery[COLOR_REVERT] is the intermediate level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession Butcher produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butchery[COLOR_REVERT] is the intermediate level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession Butcher produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slaughterhouse[COLOR_REVERT] is the highest level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_SHEEP]Butcher (Sheep)[\LINK] or [LINK=PROFESSION_BUTCHER_CATTLE]Butcher (Cattle)[\LINK] produce [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK], and [LINK=YIELD_WOOL]Wool[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HIDES]Cowhides[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK]. They do this just as fast as they would in a [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERY]Butchery[\LINK], but they receive a 50% bonus for the production of Wool and Cowhides as well. Use [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master Butchers[\LINK] to drastically increase the output.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information about obtaining Food, see [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Food[\LINK].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Abattoir[COLOR_REVERT] est le bâtiment le plus avancé pour procéder la viande. Les colons avec pour profession boucher produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nourriture[COLOR_REVERT], de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]laine[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]peaux[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mouton[COLOR_REVERT] et de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bétail[COLOR_REVERT]. Assignez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]maîtres bouchers[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre production.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schlachthaus[COLOR_REVERT] ist die höchste Ausbaustufe des Gebäudes zum Schlachten von Vieh. Siedler im Beruf des Metzgers produzieren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nahrung[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolle[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rinderhäute[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schafen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rindern[COLOR_REVERT]. Durch [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Metzger[COLOR_REVERT] wird die Produktion drastisch erhöht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slaughterhouse[COLOR_REVERT] is the highest level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession Butcher produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slaughterhouse[COLOR_REVERT] is the highest level of buildings for butchers. Colonists with profession Butcher produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT]. Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Butchers[COLOR_REVERT] to drastically increase the output.

TEXT.English: You can assign colonists to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lumberjack (Valuable Wood)[COLOR_REVERT] profession, and have them harvest [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Valuable Wood[\LINK] from [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taiga[\LINK] or [LINK=FEAUTRE_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK]. If an [LINK=UNIT_LUMBERJACK]Expert Lumberjack[\LINK] is assigned to this profession, you will receive additional Valuable Wood at no extra cost.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bois précieux[COLOR_REVERT] se trouve dans la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]jungle[COLOR_REVERT] et la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]taïga[COLOR_REVERT]. Un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]expert bücheron[COLOR_REVERT] produit davantage de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bois précieux[COLOR_REVERT] que les autres colons.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Valuable Wood[COLOR_REVERT] is available in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Jungles[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taiga[COLOR_REVERT]. If an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Lumberjack[COLOR_REVERT] is assigned to this profession, you will receive additional [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Valuable Wood[COLOR_REVERT] at no extra cost.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Valuable Wood[COLOR_REVERT] is available in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Jungles[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taiga[COLOR_REVERT]. If an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Lumberjack[COLOR_REVERT] is assigned to this profession, you will receive additional [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Valuable Wood[COLOR_REVERT] at no extra cost.

If an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Lumberjack[COLOR_REVERT] is assigned to this profession, you will receive additional [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Valuable Wood[COLOR_REVERT] at no extra cost.

TEXT.English: In the [LINK=BUILDING_BREWERS_HOUSE]Brewer's House[\LINK] or one of its upgrades, you can make colonists work as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brewers[COLOR_REVERT], and have them brew [LINK=YIELD_BEER]Beer[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK]. The output of Beer can be increased greatly by employing [LINK=UNIT_BREWER]Master Brewers[\LINK] for this job.
TEXT.French: Les brasseurs distillent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bière[COLOR_REVERT] à partir d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]orge[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Bierbrauer produzieren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bier[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gerste[COLOR_REVERT]. Dieser Prozess ist noch effektiver, wenn Sie dem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Bierbrauer[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen.
TEXT.Italian: Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: If you have a [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]Butcher's House[\LINK] or one of its upgrades present, you can make colonists work in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butcher (Cattle)[COLOR_REVERT] profession. They produce [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HIDES]Cowhides[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK]. The output of both of these resources is doubled is you employ a [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master Butcher[\LINK] for this.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information about Food production, see [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Food[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Les bouchers produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nourriture[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]peaux[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bétail[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Metzger erzeugen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nahrung[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rinderhäute[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vieh[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Butchers produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Butchers produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: If you have a [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]Butcher's House[\LINK] or one of its upgrades present, you can make colonists work in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Butcher (Sheep)[COLOR_REVERT] profession. They produce [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_WOOL]Wool[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK]. The output of both of these resources is doubled is you employ a [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master Butcher[\LINK] for this.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information about Food production, see [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Food[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Les bouchers produisent de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nourriture[COLOR_REVERT] et de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]laine[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mouton[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Metzger erzeugen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nahrung[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wolle[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schafen[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Butchers produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Butchers produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wool[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Furniture Makers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_FURNITURE_MAKERS_HOUSE]Cabinet Maker's House[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FURNITURE]Furniture[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Valuable Wood[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_FURNITURE_MAKER]Master Cabinetmakers[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of Furniture.
TEXT.French: Les ébénistes produisent des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]meubles[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bois précieux[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Möbelschreiner produzieren teure [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Möbel[COLOR_REVERT] aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Edelholz[COLOR_REVERT]. Dieser Prozess ist noch effektiver, wenn Sie dem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Möbelschreiner[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen.
TEXT.Italian: Brewers brew [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Furniture Makers produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Furniture[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Valuable Wood[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Colonists working in the [LINK=BUILDING_SPICE_TRADER_HOUSE]Spice Trader's House[\LINK] or one of its upgrades can work as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Salt Traders[COLOR_REVERT], and transform [LINK=YIELD_RAW_SALT]Rock Salt[\LINK] to make [LINK=YIELD_SALT]Salt[\LINK]. Assigning a [LINK=UNIT_SPICE_TRADER]Master Spice Trader[\LINK] to this profession even doubles the output of Salt, as long as enough Rock Salt is available.
TEXT.French: Les marchands de sel affinent le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sel brut[COLOR_REVERT] en [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sel alimentaire[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Salzhändler verarbeiten [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Steinsalz[COLOR_REVERT] zu [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Salt[COLOR_REVERT]. Dieser Prozess ist noch effektiver, wenn Sie dem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Gewürzhändler[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen.
TEXT.Italian: Salt Traders refine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stone Salt[COLOR_REVERT] to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Salt[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Salt Traders refine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stone Salt[COLOR_REVERT] to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Salt[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Colonists working in the [LINK=BUILDING_TANNERS_HOUSE]Tanner's House[\LINK] or one of its upgrades take up the profession of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tanner[COLOR_REVERT], and produce [LINK=YIELD_LEATHER]Leather[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_HIDES]Cowhides[\LINK]. This art is mastered by [LINK=UNIT_TANNER]Master Tanners[\LINK], who produce Leather much quicker than your average colonist, as long as enough Cowhides are present.
TEXT.French: Les tanneurs produisent du [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cuir[COLOR_REVERT] à partir de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]peaux[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Gerber verarbeiten [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rinderhäute[COLOR_REVERT] zu [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leder[COLOR_REVERT]. Dieser Prozess ist noch effektiver, wenn Sie dem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Gerber[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen.
TEXT.Italian: Tanners produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leather Goods[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Tanners produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leather Goods[COLOR_REVERT] from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hides[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Taiga
Cod

[BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cod[COLOR_REVERT] lives in the deep [LINK=TERRAIN_OCEAN]Ocean[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cod is the common name for the genus Gadus of demersal fishes. Cod is also used as part of the common name for a number of other fish species. The two most important species of cod are the Atlantic cod, which lives in the colder waters and deeper sea regions throughout the North Atlantic, and the Pacific cod, found in both eastern and western regions of the northern Pacific. Cod is popular as a food with a mild flavour and a dense, flaky white flesh.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le cabillaud est un nom vernaculaire désignant en français des poissons de plusieurs espèces de l'ordre des Gadiformes. Ces poissons vivent dans les eaux froides. Auparavant populaire et méprisé, ce grand poisson est présent aujourd'hui sur la carte de bien des restaurants pour sa saveur et les multiples préparations dont il fait l'objet. En effet, sa chair est particulièrement appréciée car, dépourvue de fines arêtes, elle se détache facilement de l'épine dorsale et des robustes côtes. La pêche en surnombre est à l'origine de sa rapide raréfaction, à l'exception des stocks de cabillauds de la mer de Barents dont la quantité augmente depuis le milieu des années 2000.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Vorkommen von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kabeljau[COLOR_REVERT] sind gelegentlich im tiefen [LINK=TERRAIN_OCEAN]Ozean[\LINK] zu finden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Kabeljau ist ein gebräuchlicher name für mehrere Fischarten. Die zwei wichtigsten Spezies sind der Atlantik Kabeljau, der in den kalten und tieferen Regionen des Nordatlantiks vorkommt und der Pazifik Kabeljau, der im nördlichen Pazifik zu finden ist. Kabeljau ist euafgrund seines milden Geschmacks und seimen festen, weissen Fleisch sehr beliebt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Cod is the common name for the genus Gadus of demersal fishes. Cod is also used as part of the common name for a number of other fish species. The two most important species of cod are the Atlantic cod, which lives in the colder waters and deeper sea regions throughout the North Atlantic, and the Pacific cod, found in both eastern and western regions of the northern Pacific. Cod is popular as a food with a mild flavour and a dense, flaky white flesh.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Cod is the common name for the genus Gadus of demersal fishes. Cod is also used as part of the common name for a number of other fish species. The two most important species of cod are the Atlantic cod, which lives in the colder waters and deeper sea regions throughout the North Atlantic, and the Pacific cod, found in both eastern and western regions of the northern Pacific. Cod is popular as a food with a mild flavour and a dense, flaky white flesh.

TEXT.English: Fishing Boat:Fishing Boats

[TAB]The development of fishing boats took place in parallel with the development of boats built for trade and war. Early navigators began to use animal skins or woven fabrics for sails. Affixed to a pole set upright in the boat, these sails gave early boats more range, allowing voyages of exploration. In the 15th century, the Dutch developed a type of sea-going herring drifter that became a blueprint for European fishing boats. During the 17th century, the British developed the dogger, an early type of sailing trawler or longliner, which commonly operated in the North Sea. The dogger takes its name from the Dutch word dogger, meaning a fishing vessel which tows a trawl. Dutch trawling boats were common in the North Sea, and the word dogger was given to the area where they often fished, which became known as the Dogger Bank. Doggers were slow but sturdy, capable of fishing in the rough conditions of the North Sea. Like the herring buss, they were wide-beamed and bluff-bowed, but considerably smaller, about 15 metres long, a maximum beam of 4.5 metres, a draught of 1.5 metres, and displacing about 13 tonnes. They could carry a tonne of bait, three tonnes of salt, half a tonne each of food and firewood for the crew, and return with six tonnes of fish. Decked areas forward and aft probably provided accommodation, storage and a cooking area. An anchor would have allowed extended periods fishing in the same spot, in waters up to 18 metres deep. The dogger would also have carried a small open boat for maintaining lines and rowing ashore.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le bateau de pêche désigne l'ensemble des navires pratiquant la pêche. En général, le nom d'un type de bateaux est relation avec la pêche qu'il pratique, type de poissons ou technique utilisée.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Tätigkeit als Fischer ist bereits für die frühesten menschlichen Gesellschaftsformen der Wildbeuter anzunehmen. Den Beruf des Fischers gibt es oft schon in Gesellschaften mit nur geringer Arbeitsteilung. Er setzt den Besitz und die Beherrschung ganz spezieller Arbeitsmittel wie Fischerboot, Piroge oder Fischkutter sowie von Fischernetzen voraus.

In the 15th century, the Dutch developed a type of sea-going herring drifter that became a blueprint for European fishing boats. During the 17th century, the British developed the dogger, an early type of sailing trawler or longliner, which commonly operated in the North Sea. The dogger takes its name from the Dutch word dogger, meaning a fishing vessel which tows a trawl. Dutch trawling boats were common in the North Sea, and the word dogger was given to the area where they often fished, which became known as the Dogger Bank. Doggers were slow but sturdy, capable of fishing in the rough conditions of the North Sea. Like the herring buss, they were wide-beamed and bluff-bowed, but considerably smaller, about 15 metres long, a maximum beam of 4.5 metres, a draught of 1.5 metres, and displacing about 13 tonnes. They could carry a tonne of bait, three tonnes of salt, half a tonne each of food and firewood for the crew, and return with six tonnes of fish. Decked areas forward and aft probably provided accommodation, storage and a cooking area. An anchor would have allowed extended periods fishing in the same spot, in waters up to 18 metres deep. The dogger would also have carried a small open boat for maintaining lines and rowing ashore.

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fishing Boat[COLOR_REVERT] on a water tile with the [LINK=BONUS_HIGH_SEA_FISH]Cod[\LINK], [LINK=BONUS_PEARLS]Shellfish[\LINK], [LINK=BONUS_FISH]Fish[\LINK] or [LINK=BONUS_CRAB]Crabs[\LINK] Resource can be given order to start [LINK=CONCEPT_WHALING]Fishing[\LINK] and gather [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from that resource. Fishing Boats are the only units to which this mission is available.[NEWLINE]Every game turn, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Food[COLOR_REVERT] is harvested and put into the cargo hold. Each Bonus Resource can be harvested by only a single Fishing Boat at a time, and Bonus resources which fall inside a settlement's City Radius, or inside another nation's borders, cannot be harvested.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fishing Boats[COLOR_REVERT] are very weak, and do not stand a chance against other ships and even can even be troubled by Ocean-bound [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wild Animals[\LINK]. They can be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Dock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. They are cheap, but they require [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bateau de pêche[COLOR_REVERT] sur une case d'océan disposant de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cabillaud[COLOR_REVERT] ou d'autres ressources comme du [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]poisson[COLOR_REVERT] ou du [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]crabe[COLOR_REVERT] peuvent alors [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]pêcher[COLOR_REVERT]. Les bateaux de pêche sont les seuls unités qui peuvent exercer cette mission. A chaque tour, du [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]poisson[COLOR_REVERT] est prélevé et ajouté à la cargaison. Un seul bateau peut pêcher sur une case à la fois.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fischerboot[COLOR_REVERT] kann auf Ozean Felder mit der Resource [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kabejau[COLOR_REVERT] oder anderen Resourcen, wie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fisch[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Krabben[COLOR_REVERT] mit dem [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fischfang[COLOR_REVERT] beginnen. Fischerboote sind die einzige Einheit denen dies möglich ist. Jede Runde wird [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fisch[COLOR_REVERT] gefangen und im Frachtraum gelagert. Auf einer Resource kann immer nur ein Fischerboot gleichzeitig mit dem Fang beschäftigt sein.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fishing Boat[COLOR_REVERT] on an ocean tile with a bonus resource [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cod[COLOR_REVERT] or other kinds ressources like [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fish[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Crabs[COLOR_REVERT] can be given order to start [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fishing[COLOR_REVERT]. Fishing boats are the only units to which this mission is available. Every game turn, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fish[COLOR_REVERT] is harvested and put into the cargo hold. Each of these bonus resource can be harvested by only a single fishing boat at a time.

[TAB][H1]COCA LEAVES[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coca Leaves[COLOR_REVERT] can be cultivated exclusively on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] regions with little or no vegetation, by assigning a colonist to the [LINK=PROFESSION_COCA_COLLECTOR]Coca Collector[\LINK] profession. The yield will be higher when the [LINK=BONUS_COCA]Coca Plants[\LINK] bonus is present, and can also be increased by constructing [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST2]Coca Posts[\LINK], and by employing [LINK=UNIT_COCA_COLLECTOR]Expert Coca Collectors[\LINK], who produce double the amount of Coca Leaves any other colonist would produce. [PARAGRAPH:1]As Coca Leaves, once they are picked, are immediately ready for use, they cannot be converted into manufactured goods, but its price is slightly higher than the price of other raw materials.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Coca Leaves can refer to leaves of all four cultivated plants of the Coca family (Erythoxylaceae), native to western South America. In times both ancient and modern, these plants have been highly valued for their psychoactive properties, which can be experienced by chewing the leaves, making coca tea ("Mate de coca") out of it and, in modern times, chemically extracting the psychoactive agents to produce the drug Cocaine. Coca Leaves are an effective remedy against altitude sickness, and bestows upon its consumer a greater tolerance for hunger, thirst and fatigue. Apart from that, coca can be used as an anaesthetic as well, and due to its religious significance in indigenous cultures, many other properties are ascribed to it, some of which are supported by modern science.[PARAGRAPH:1] Coca Leaves have been used for medicinal, nutritional and religious purposes in the Andean region since prehistoric times, possibly as long as 8000 years before present time. It was during this long period that the ancestral coca plant was eventually domesticated, after which it diversified into the four modern species. In the Incan Empire, the plant was thought to have a divine origin, and its leaves were used as offerings, as a method of divination, similar to the reading of tea leaves in the old world, and also as preparation for prayers or religious ceremonies. It eventually spread to a large area, ranging from Colombia in the north to Chile in the south. [PARAGRAPH:2] After the Spanish conquest of the Incan Empire, the use of the leaf was tolerated by the Spanish, as it also enhanced the performance of forced laborers, but its religious use was prohibited, and the Spanish themselves were discouraged from using it. Though it was introduced in Europe in the 16th Century, it did not actually become popular until the 19th Century, when the first cocaine was produced.
TEXT.French: [TAB][H1]FEUILLES DE COCA[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] La coca est une plante d'Amérique du Sud de la famille des Érythroxylacées. Elle joue un rôle important dans la culture andine, à travers ses utilisations rituelles ou médicinales des [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]feuilles de coca[\LINK]. [PARAGRAPH:1] Elle pousse à l'état sauvage dans la cordillère des Andes à des altitudes variant de 300 à 2 000 m. Comme toutes les espèces du genre Erythroxylum, elle apprécie particulièrement les sols acides. [PARAGRAPH:1]C'est un fondement culturel pour l'Amérique latine - notamment les hauts plateaux andins - où son usage remonte à près de 5 000 ans2. Du fait de ses différentes vertus, c'est une plante sacrée pour certains peuples amérindiens. Pour ces derniers, Mama Coca est la fille de Pachamama. Elle est ainsi utilisée traditionnellement de la Colombie jusqu'au Chili aussi bien pour ses vertus stimulantes que dans le cadre de cérémonies religieuses, elle aurait même servi de taxe d'imposition. Dans l'Empire inca, la coca issue de l'actuel Pérou (tupa coca) servait aux cérémonies religieuses et aux dignitaires alors que la coca issue de l'actuelle Bolivie (muma coca) servait aux fonctionnaires voire au peuple. Son usage est signalé par les conquérants espagnols dès le XVIe siècle qui en condamnent d'abord l'usage la qualifiant de satanique avant de l'encourager en constatant l'efficacité en termes de rentabilité sur les travailleurs3. C'est Nicolas Monardés de Séville, un naturaliste espagnol qui en donne la première description dans les années 1580 même si la plante ne sera vraiment connue sur le plan scientifique qu'au XVIIIe siècle3.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Cocablätter[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cocablätter[COLOR_REVERT] können nur auf Hügeln der [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK] angebaut werden. Hierfür muss einem Kolonisten der Beruf [LINK=PROFESSION_COCA_COLLECTOR]Cocasammler[\LINK] zugewiesen werden. Ein [LINK=UNIT_COCA_COLLECTOR]Erfahrener Cocasammler[\LINK] ist hierin besonders effektiv. Die höchsten Erträge können auf Felder erzielt werden, auf denen die Bonus Ressource [LINK=BONUS_COCA]Cocapflanzen[\LINK] vorkommt. Durch den Bau von [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST2]Cocasammelstellen[\LINK] kann der Ertrag weiter erhöht werden.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cocablätter können nicht weiter verarbeitet werden, erzielen aber einen leicht höheren Preis als viele andere Rohstoffe.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Der Begriff Cocablätter bezieht sich meist auf Blätter der kultivierten Planzen aus der Familie der Cocapflanzen (Erythoxylaceae), welche im westlichen Teil Südamerikas beheimatet sind. Sowohl in der alten Geschichte, wie auch in der modernen Zeit wurden diese Pflanzen sehr hoch geschätzt, da sie psychoaktive Substanzen beinhalten, die man durch das Kauen der Blätter oder durch den Konsum des daraus aufgebrühten Tees aufnehmen kann. In der heutigen Zeit, wird aus diesen Blättern auch die Droge Kokain gewonnen. Weniger bedenkliche Anwirkungen der Cocablätter sind aber beispielsweise die Anwendung in geringeren Mengen als Mittel gegen Höhenkrankheit oder gegen Hungergefühle, Durstgefühle oder Müdigkeit. Ausserdem kann Coca auch zur Betäubung von Schmerzen verwendet werden.[PARAGRAPH:1] Cocablätter wurden jeher in den Regionen der Anden zu relgiösen, medizinischen und nahrungsergänzenden Zwecken eingesetzt. Wahrscheinlich sogar weit länger als 8000 Jahre. In dieser langen Zeitperiode wurde die Cocapflanze irgendwann domestiziert. Heutzutage wird sie in vier unterschiedlichen Gattungen bzw. Unterarten gezüchtet. Das Imperium der Inkas glaubte an einen göttlichen Ursprung der Planze und verwendeten die Blätter als Opfergaben, aber auch als Mittel um die Zukunft voherzusagen oder einfach nur um Gebete und Zeremonien vorzubereiten. Die Pflanze breitete sich schliesslich über ein sehr grosses Gebiet von Kolumbien im Norden bis Chile im Süden aus. [PARAGRAPH:2] Nach der spanischen Eroberung des Inkareiches wurde die Einnahme der Pflanze weiterhin von den Spaniern toleriert, da sie die Leistung der Zwangsarbeiter steigerte. Die religiöse Verwendung der Pflanze wurde aber verboten. Den Spaniern selbst wurde davon abgeraten die Blätter zu konsumieren. Obwohlb bereits im 16ten Jahrhundert Cocablätter in Europa bekannt waren, erlangten diese dort zu dieser Zeit nie Beliebtheit. Dies änderte sich erst als im 19ten Jahrhundert Kokain entdeckt wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB][H1]COCA LEAVES[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Coca Leaves[\LINK] can refer to leaves of all four cultivated plants of the Coca family (Erythoxylaceae), native to western South America. In times both ancient and modern, these plants have been highly valued for their psychoactive properties, which can be experienced by chewing the leaves, making coca tea ("Mate de coca") out of it and, in modern times, chemically extracting the psychoactive agents to produce the drug Cocaine. Coca Leaves are an effective remedy against altitude sickness, and bestows upon its consumer a greater tolerance for hunger, thirst and fatigue. Apart from that, coca can be used as an anaesthetic as well, and due to its religious significance in indigenous cultures, many other properties are ascribed to it, some of which are supported by modern science.[PARAGRAPH:1] Coca Leaves have been used for medicinal, nutritional and religious purposes in the Andean region since prehistoric times, possibly as long as 8000 years before present time. It was during this long period that the ancestral coca plant was eventually domesticated, after which it diversified into the four modern species. In the Incan Empire, the plant was thought to have a divine origin, and its leaves were used as offerings, as a method of divination, similar to the reading of tea leaves in the old world, and also as preparation for prayers or religious ceremonies. It eventually spread to a large area, ranging from Colombia in the north to Chile in the south. [PARAGRAPH:2] After the Spanish conquest of the Incan Empire, the use of the leaf was tolerated by the Spanish, as it also enhanced the performance of forced laborers, but its religious use was prohibited, and the Spanish themselves were discouraged from using it. Though it was introduced in Europe in the 16th Century, it did not actually become popular until the 19th Century, when the first cocaine was produced.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coca Plants[COLOR_REVERT] are endemic to highlands at tropical latitudes. They grow only on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] terrain that is either open or overgrown by [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungle[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forest[\LINK] or [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forest[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Coca Leaves can refer to leaves of all four cultivated plants of the Coca family (Erythoxylaceae), native to western South America. In times both ancient and modern, these plants have been highly valued for their psychoactive properties, which can be experienced by chewing the leaves, making coca tea ("Mate de coca") out of it and, in modern times, chemically extracting the psychoactive agents to produce the drug Cocaine. Coca Leaves are an effective remedy against altitude sickness, and bestows upon its consumer a greater tolerance for hunger, thirst and fatigue. Apart from that, coca can be used as an anaesthetic as well, and due to its religious significance in indigenous cultures, many other properties are ascribed to it, some of which are supported by modern science.[PARAGRAPH:1] Coca Leaves have been used for medicinal, nutritional and religious purposes in the Andean region since prehistoric times, possibly as long as 8000 years before present time. It was during this long period that the ancestral coca plant was eventually domesticated, after which it diversified into the four modern species. In the Incan Empire, the plant was thought to have a divine origin, and its leaves were used as offerings, as a method of divination, similar to the reading of tea leaves in the old world, and also as preparation for prayers or religious ceremonies. It eventually spread to a large area, ranging from Colombia in the north to Chile in the south. [PARAGRAPH:2] After the Spanish conquest of the Incan Empire, the use of the leaf was tolerated by the Spanish, as it also enhanced the performance of forced laborers, but its religious use was prohibited, and the Spanish themselves were discouraged from using it. TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cocapflanzen[COLOR_REVERT] sind in tropischen Breitengraden auf hügeliger [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK] beheimatet. Gelegentlich können besonders gute Anbaugebiete für Cocapflanzen auch von [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Dschungel[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Wald[\LINK] oder [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Buschland[\LINK] überwachsen sein.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cocapflanzen[COLOR_REVERT] sind in den Höhenlagen tropischer Breitengrade beheimatet. Sie wachsen im Hügelland der [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK]. [PARAGRAPH:2]Der Begriff [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Cocablätter[\LINK] bezieht sich meist auf Blätter der kultivierten Planzen aus der Familie der Cocapflanzen (Erythoxylaceae), welche im westlichen Teil Südamerikas beheimatet sind. Sowohl in der alten Geschichte, wie auch in der modernen Zeit wurden diese Pflanzen sehr hoch geschätzt, da sie psychoaktive Substanzen beinhalten, die man durch das Kauen der Blätter oder durch den Konsum des daraus aufgebrühten Tees aufnehmen kann. In der heutigen Zeit, wird aus diesen Blättern auch die Droge Kokain gewonnen. Weniger bedenkliche Anwirkungen der Cocablätter sind aber beispielsweise die Anwendung in geringeren Mengen als Mittel gegen Höhenkrankheit oder gegen Hungergefühle, Durstgefühle oder Müdigkeit. Ausserdem kann Coca auch zur Betäubung von Schmerzen verwendet werden.[PARAGRAPH:1] Cocablätter wurden jeher in den Regionen der Anden zu relgiösen, medizinischen und nahrungsergänzenden Zwecken eingesetzt. Wahrscheinlich sogar weit länger als 8000 Jahre. In dieser langen Zeitperiode wurde die Cocapflanze irgendwann domestiziert. Heutzutage wird sie in vier unterschiedlichen Gattungen bzw. Unterarten gezüchtet. Das Imperium der Inkas glaubte an einen göttlichen Ursprung der Planze und verwendeten die Blätter als Opfergaben, aber auch als Mittel um die Zukunft voherzusagen oder einfach nur um Gebete und Zeremonien vorzubereiten. Die Pflanze breitete sich schliesslich über ein sehr grosses Gebiet von Kolumbien im Norden bis Chile im Süden aus. [PARAGRAPH:2] Nach der spanischen Eroberung des Inkareiches wurde die Einnahme der Pflanze weiterhin von den Spaniern toleriert, da sie die Leistung der Zwangsarbeiter steigerte. Die religiöse Verwendung der Pflanze wurde aber verboten. Den Spaniern selbst wurde davon abgeraten die Blätter zu konsumieren. Obwohlb bereits im 16ten Jahrhundert Cocablätter in Europa bekannt waren, erlangten diese dort zu dieser Zeit nie Beliebtheit. Dies änderte sich erst als im 19ten Jahrhundert Kokain entdeckt wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coca Plants[COLOR_REVERT] are endemic to highlands at tropical latitudes. They grow only on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] terrain. [PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Coca Leaves[\LINK] can refer to leaves of all four cultivated plants of the Coca family (Erythoxylaceae), native to western South America. In times both ancient and modern, these plants have been highly valued for their psychoactive properties, which can be experienced by chewing the leaves, making coca tea ("Mate de coca") out of it and, in modern times, chemically extracting the psychoactive agents to produce the drug Cocaine. Coca Leaves are an effective remedy against altitude sickness, and bestows upon its consumer a greater tolerance for hunger, thirst and fatigue. Apart from that, coca can be used as an anaesthetic as well, and due to its religious significance in indigenous cultures, many other properties are ascribed to it, some of which are supported by modern science.[PARAGRAPH:1] Coca Leaves have been used for medicinal, nutritional and religious purposes in the Andean region since prehistoric times, possibly as long as 8000 years before present time. It was during this long period that the ancestral coca plant was eventually domesticated, after which it diversified into the four modern species. In the Incan Empire, the plant was thought to have a divine origin, and its leaves were used as offerings, as a method of divination, similar to the reading of tea leaves in the old world, and also as preparation for prayers or religious ceremonies. It eventually spread to a large area, ranging from Colombia in the north to Chile in the south. [PARAGRAPH:2] After the Spanish conquest of the Incan Empire, the use of the leaf was tolerated by the Spanish, as it also enhanced the performance of forced laborers, but its religious use was prohibited, and the Spanish themselves were discouraged from using it. Though it was introduced in Europe in the 16th Century, it did not actually become popular until the 19th Century, when the first cocaine was produced.

TEXT.French: La coca est une plante d'Amérique du Sud de la famille des Érythroxylacées. Elle joue un rôle important dans la culture andine, à travers ses utilisations rituelles ou médicinales des [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]feuilles de coca[\LINK]. [PARAGRAPH:1] Elle pousse à l'état sauvage dans la cordillère des Andes à des altitudes variant de 300 à 2 000 m. Comme toutes les espèces du genre Erythroxylum, elle apprécie particulièrement les sols acides. [PARAGRAPH:1]C'est un fondement culturel pour l'Amérique latine - notamment les hauts plateaux andins - où son usage remonte à près de 5 000 ans2. Du fait de ses différentes vertus, c'est une plante sacrée pour certains peuples amérindiens. Pour ces derniers, Mama Coca est la fille de Pachamama. Elle est ainsi utilisée traditionnellement de la Colombie jusqu'au Chili aussi bien pour ses vertus stimulantes que dans le cadre de cérémonies religieuses, elle aurait même servi de taxe d'imposition. Dans l'Empire inca, la coca issue de l'actuel Pérou (tupa coca) servait aux cérémonies religieuses et aux dignitaires alors que la coca issue de l'actuelle Bolivie (muma coca) servait aux fonctionnaires voire au peuple. Son usage est signalé par les conquérants espagnols dès le XVIe siècle qui en condamnent d'abord l'usage la qualifiant de satanique avant de l'encourager en constatant l'efficacité en termes de rentabilité sur les travailleurs3. C'est Nicolas Monardés de Séville, un naturaliste espagnol qui en donne la première description dans les années 1580 même si la plante ne sera vraiment connue sur le plan scientifique qu'au XVIIIe siècle3.

Unterarten gezüchtet. Weniger bedenkliche Anwirkungen der Cocablätter sind aber beispielsweise die Anwendung in geringeren Mengen als Mittel gegen Höhenkrankheit oder gegen Hungergefühle, Durstgefühle oder Müdigkeit. Ausserdem kann Coca auch zur Betäubung von Schmerzen verwendet werden.[PARAGRAPH:1] Cocablätter wurden jeher in den Regionen der Anden zu relgiösen, medizinischen und nahrungsergänzenden Zwecken eingesetzt. Wahrscheinlich sogar weit länger als 8000 Jahre. In dieser langen Zeitperiode wurde die Cocapflanze irgendwann domestiziert. Heutzutage wird sie in vier unterschiedlichen Gattungen bzw. Unterarten gezüchtet. Das Imperium der Inkas glaubte an einen göttlichen Ursprung der Planze und verwendeten die Blätter als Opfergaben, aber auch als Mittel um die Zukunft voherzusagen oder einfach nur um Gebete und Zeremonien vorzubereiten. Die Pflanze breitete sich schliesslich über ein sehr grosses Gebiet von Kolumbien im Norden bis Chile im Süden aus. [PARAGRAPH:2] Nach der spanischen Eroberung des Inkareiches wurde die Einnahme der Pflanze weiterhin von den Spaniern toleriert, da sie die Leistung der Zwangsarbeiter steigerte. Die religiöse Verwendung der Pflanze wurde aber verboten. Den Spaniern selbst wurde davon abgeraten die Blätter zu konsumieren. Obwohlb bereits im 16ten Jahrhundert Cocablätter in Europa bekannt waren, erlangten diese dort zu dieser Zeit nie Beliebtheit. Dies änderte sich erst als im 19ten Jahrhundert Kokain entdeckt wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Coca Leaves can refer to leaves of all four cultivated plants of the Coca family (Erythoxylaceae), native to western South America. In times both ancient and modern, these plants have been highly valued for their psychoactive properties, which can be experienced by chewing the leaves, making coca tea ("Mate de coca") out of it and, in modern times, chemically extracting the psychoactive agents to produce the drug Cocaine. Coca Leaves are an effective remedy against altitude sickness, and bestows upon its consumer a greater tolerance for hunger, thirst and fatigue. Apart from that, coca can be used as an anaesthetic as well, and due to its religious significance in indigenous cultures, many other properties are ascribed to it, some of which are supported by modern science.[PARAGRAPH:1] Coca Leaves have been used for medicinal, nutritional and religious purposes in the Andean region since prehistoric times, possibly as long as 8000 years before present time. It was during this long period that the ancestral coca plant was eventually domesticated, after which it diversified into the four modern species. In the Incan Empire, the plant was thought to have a divine origin, and its leaves were used as offerings, as a method of divination, similar to the reading of tea leaves in the old world, and also as preparation for prayers or religious ceremonies. It eventually spread to a large area, ranging from Colombia in the north to Chile in the south. [PARAGRAPH:2] After the Spanish conquest of the Incan Empire, the use of the leaf was tolerated by the Spanish, as it also enhanced the performance of forced laborers, but its religious use was prohibited, and the Spanish themselves were discouraged from using it. Though it was introduced in Europe in the 16th Century, it did not actually become popular until the 19th Century, when the first cocaine was produced.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coca Collectors[COLOR_REVERT] can gather [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Coca Leaves[\LINK] from hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] regions with little or no vegetation. The yield will be higher when the [LINK=BONUS_COCA]Coca Plants[\LINK] bonus is present, and can also be increased by constructing [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST2]Coca Posts[\LINK]. If unspecialized colonists practice this profession long enough, they will eventually become [LINK=UNIT_COCA_COLLECTOR]Expert Coca Collectors[\LINK], who produce double the amount of Coca Leaves any other colonist would produce.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]planteurs de coca[COLOR_REVERT] peuvent cultiver des [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]feuilles de coca[\LINK] sur des cases de [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savane[\LINK] vallonnée qui ont peu de végétation. La production est plus importante lorsqu'un bonus de [LINK=BONUS_COCA]plante de coca[\LINK] est présent. Elle est également augmenté en construisant un [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST2]dépôt de coca[\LINK]. Si un colon non spécialisé pratique cette profession suffisament longtemps, alors il pourrait devenir un [LINK=UNIT_COCA_COLLECTOR]Expert planteur de coca[\LINK], et produire ainsi deux fois plus de feuilles de coca qu'un autre colon.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cocasammler[COLOR_REVERT] können [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Cocablätter[\LINK] von Hügeln auf Regionen der [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] sammeln. Der Ertrag ist höher, wenn es auf dem Feld auch die Bonusresource [LINK=BONUS_COCA]Cocapflanzen[\LINK] gibt und kann noch weiter erhöht werden, wenn man darauf die Geländeverbesserung [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST2]Cocasammelstelle[\LINK] errichtet. Wenn ein nicht spezialisierter Kolonist lange genug diesen Beruf ausübt, kann er irgendwann zu einem [LINK=UNIT_COCA_COLLECTOR]Erfahrenen Cocasammler[\LINK] werden, der doppelt soviele Cocablätter ernten kann.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Coca Collectors[COLOR_REVERT] are specialists in growing, maintaining and harvesting [LINK=BONUS_COCA]Coca Plants[\LINK]. When assigned to gather [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Coca Leaves[\LINK], Expert Coca Collectors will generate twice as much Coca Leaves as other colonists. Some native villages may be willing to teach this profession to European colonists, and they can also be [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Trained[\LINK] in a colony with a [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]College[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Experts planteurs de coca[COLOR_REVERT] sont les cultivateurs spécialistes des [LINK=BONUS_COCA]plants de coca[\LINK]. Lorsqu'assigné à la cueillette de [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]feuilles de coca[\LINK], ils produisent deux fois plus de feuilles de coca que les autres colons. Certains villages indigènes voudront peut être apprendre cette profession aux colons européen. Ils peuvent également [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]enseigner[\LINK] leur métier dans une [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]académie[\LINK] ou une [LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]université[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Erfahrene Cocasammler[COLOR_REVERT] sind Spezialisten im Heranziehen und Ernten der Blätter der [LINK=BONUS_COCA]Cocapflanze[\LINK]. Wenn man ihnen befiehlt [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Cocablätter[\LINK] zu sammeln, sind Erfahrene Cocasammler doppelt so effektiv darin, wie andere Kolonisten. Einige Dörfer der Ureinwohner können europäischen Kolonisten diese Spezalisierung des Berufs Cocasammler beibringen.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Coca Collectors[COLOR_REVERT] are specialists in growing, maintaining and harvesting [LINK=BONUS_COCA]Coca Plants[\LINK]. When assigned to gather [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Coca Leaves[\LINK], Expert Coca Collectors will generate twice as much Coca Leaves as other colonists. Some native villages may be willing to teach this profession to European colonists.

TEXT.English: [TAB][H1]BLADES[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Blades[COLOR_REVERT] are relatively cheap weapons that can be used as equipment by [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalrymen[\LINK], as well as most military ships.[PARAGRAPH:1]To craft Blades, a colonist can convert [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Ore[\LINK] into Blades when he is assigned the [LINK=PROFESSION_BLADESMITH]Bladesmith[\LINK] profession in a [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_HOUSE]Blacksmith's House[\LINK] or any of its upgrades. The output of Blades can be doubled by employing [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]Master Blacksmiths[\LINK] for this purpose.[NEWLINE]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Guns, Cannons and Blades[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT] Blades[COLOR_REVERT] can refer to any weapon or tool with a sharp point or a sharp edge, meant for cutting or puncturing.[NEWLINE]The art of creating cutting devices is one of the oldest crafts of humanity, so old, in fact, that even non-human hominids like Neanderthals and Homo Erectus are known to have used blade- or axelike artifacts. This was a vital invention in prehistory, as cutting and stabbing devices could be used for food preparation, hunting, warfare, art, digging and creation of other tools.[NEWLINE]Blades need to be crafted from hard, tough material, which is why they are so often preserved as archeological artifacts. Because of the abundance of preserved blades, the material of which they were crafted have been used to name the three different eras of ancient history: the Stone Age, the Bronze Age and ultimately the Iron Age.[NEWLINE]Bladed weapons, such as swords, axes, spears and knives, have been the regular weapon for hand-to-hand combat for the most part of history, and they remained common in warfare until the first effective gunpowder weapons had been invented, such as handguns. They became obsolete over the course of the 19th Century, being preserved mostly as ceremonial weapons.[PARAGRAPH:2]At the time Columbus discovered America, melee weapons were still the default weapons of choice of European armies, though gunpowder weapons were becoming steadily more reliable and effective. The conquistadores combined gunpowder weapons, such as arquebuses and muskets, with melee weapons, usually side-swords or in some cases halberds, and non-gunpowdered range weapons such as crossbows.[NEWLINE]This usually gave the Europeans a huge military advantage over the native nations they encountered. While many native civilizations were quite proficient in the working of metals, they applied this technology mostly to the crafting of ceremonial objects, jewels, tools and art, not weapons for warfare. Bladed weapons were usually crafted from wood, flint or obsidian. There were exceptions to this, though, most prominently the empires of the Tarascans and the Incas, who crafted swords of copper and bronze. However, these still were no match for the iron and steel weapons of the invaders.[PARAGRAPH:2]Over the course of the colonial age, blades remained vital weapons for most armies. Examples of swords used in this period include the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT] side-sword[COLOR_REVERT], a small sword that allowed its wielder a great amount of agility in combat and was primarily useful for self-defense. A similar design was the somewhat more modern [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT] rapier[COLOR_REVERT], featuring a long, thin blade and a hilt that provides protection for the hand holding it, which due to its design, was primarily designed for thrusting, not so much for slashing.[NEWLINE]Though blades were used in official warfare as well, they achieved most of their fame as the weapon of choice for pirates. The combination of a side-sword and a buckler, a small shield, gave rise to the name "swashbuckler," because of the combination of the swashing of the sword through the air and the noise it makes when hitting a buckler.

While many native civilizations were quite proficient in the working of metals, they applied this technology mostly to the crafting of ceremonial objects, jewels, tools and art, not weapons for warfare. Bladed weapons were usually crafted from wood, flint or obsidian. There were exceptions to this, though, most prominently the empires of the Tarascans and the Incas, who crafted swords of copper and bronze. Examples of swords used in this period include the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT] side-sword[COLOR_REVERT], a small sword that allowed its wielder a great amount of agility in combat and was primarily useful for self-defense. The combination of a side-sword and a buckler, a small shield, gave rise to the name "swashbuckler," because of the combination of the swashing of the sword through the air and the noise it makes when hitting a buckler.
TEXT.German: [TAB][H1]Klingenwaffen[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Klingenwaffen[COLOR_REVERT] sind verlgeichsweise günstige Waffen. Militärberufe benötigen gerinere Mengen an Klingenwaffen, wie beispielsweise [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Kavalleristen[\LINK]. Auch einige Kriegsschiffe benötigen zum Bau kleinere Mengen an Klingenwaffen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Um Klingenwaffen herzustellen, muss einem Kolonisten der Beruf [LINK=PROFESSION_BLADESMITH]Klingenschmied[\LINK] in der [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_HOUSE]Dorfschmiede[\LINK] oder deren Ausbaustufen zugewiesen werden. Zur Herstellung von Klingenwaffen wird [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Eisenerz[\LINK] benötigt. [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]Meister Schmiede[\LINK] sind am geschicktesten in der Herstellung von Klingenwaffen.[NEWLINE]Für weiter Informationen siehe [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Schusswaffen, Kannonen und Klingen[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Der Begriff [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Klingenwaffe[COLOR_REVERT] kann sich auf jegliche Waffe beziehen, die eine eine Scharfe Schneide hat. [NEWLINE]Die Kunst der Herstellung von Klingen ist eines der ältesten Handwerke, die der Menschheit bekannt sind. Sie ist sogar so alt, dass sogar Neandertaler und der Homo Erectus bereits Klingenwaffen besassen. Es war eine lebenswichtige Erfindung in der Vorgeschichte, da sie für die Jagd, zur Zubereitung des Essens, zur Herstellung anderer Werkzeuge aber auch zu kämpferischen Zwecken benötigt wurde.[NEWLINE]Klingen müssen aus harten und robusten Materialien hergestellt werden und sind dadurch oft der Archeologie erhalten geblieben. Sie haben sogar ultimativ die Einteilung der Vorzeit in Steinzeitalter, Bronzezeitalter und Eisenzeitalter bestimmt.[NEWLINE]Klingenwaffen, wie Schwerter, Speere und Messer haben bis zu der Erfindung von Schusswaffen die Kämpfe und Schlachten der Geschichte bestimmt. Aber bereits im 19ten Jahrhundert hatten sie jegliche entscheidende Rolle in der Kriegsführung verloren und dienten fortan eher zum Sport oder zu zeremoniellen Zwecken. [PARAGRAPH:2]Zu der Zeit als Kolumbus Amerika entdeckte, waren Klingenwaffen immer noch die Hauptwaffe europäischer Armeen, obwohl Feuerwaffen bereits bekannt waren und nach und nach auch immer effektiver und zuverlässiger wurden. Die Konquistadores kombinierten Feuerwaffen, wie Musketen und Arkebusen mit Klingenwaffen, wie Schwerter und Helebarden aber auch mit anderen Waffen, wie beispielsweise Armbrüsten und erhielten dadurch erhebliche Vorteile gegen die viel schlechter ausgerüsteten Ureinwohner denen sie begegneten. [NEWLINE]Obwohl einige der Zivilisation der Ureiwohner bereits mit Metallen arbeiteten, wandten sie diese Technicken meist nicht zur Herstellung von Waffen and, sonder eher zur Herstellung von Objekten für das Handwerk oder religiöse Zeremonien. Waffen wurden meist aus Holz, Stein oder Materialien wie Obsidian hergestellt. Es gab hier nur wenige Ausnahmen, wie beispielsweise die Imperien der Taraskan oder der Inkas, die Klingen auch aus Kupfer oder Bronze ferigten. Diese stellten aber die eisernen Waffen der europäischen Invasoren ebenfalls nicht vor eine Herausforderung.[PARAGRAPH:2]Während des Kolonialzeitalters blieben Klingen weiterhin ein essentieller Teilder Bewaffnung der Armeen. Ein gutes Beispiel hierfür ist die Gattunt der Seitenschwerter oder in der etwas moderneren Ausführung der Rapiere.[NEWLINE]Auch bei Piraten waren Klingen, vorallem Schwerter, zu dieser Zeit sehr beliebt.
